experience: For those of you who missed it last week, you can check out the State of Women in Engineering panel here:
Join me today from 1-2:30 pm Central as I present findings from our upcoming AWIS report at Society of Women Engineers State of Women in Engineering panel, live-streaming at https://we17.swe.org/
Working on taking down systemic harassment with Association for Women in Science and Alexandra Tracy-Ramirez.

The topic I'm interviewed about the most by the media is harassment and assault in STEM. I regularly point out it's a pervasive and systemic issue about power. Yes, individuals are involved, those who misuse that power need to be held accountable, and those who are targeted for that misuse need to be supported. And also, until we change the system, cases like those described in this article will continue to occur.

Feeling inspired by our STEM to Market AWIS Accelerator entrepreneurs and Intentional Investors after an engaging day together in DC! Thank you, Mary Kombolias, Jasmine Bridges, Misra, Kamana, Kelsey Kennedy, Chinonye Nnakwe, PhD, Felicia A. McClary, Ph.D., Gloria González, PhD, Irena Vodenska, PhD, CFA, Dorothy Phoenix, Erin M. Kelley, Jennifer Mintz Clark, Joan Herbers, Jean Schelhorn, Janet Bandows Koster, Cindy Simpson, MEd, CAE, CGMP, Aspen Russell, Lori Devine, Christin McGrath, Ramphis Castro, Jennifer Shieh, and Bethany Quinn!

recommendations: Public programming, curriculum & culture, educational research
December 7, 2016, Heather worked with Lara dos Passos in the same group

Heather is a rigorous, highly collaborative researcher who is as abreast of changes in her field as she is grounded in the critical foundational philosophies that drive compelling analyses. It is always a stimulating and enjoyable experience sharing time and space with her intellectually.

summary: Experienced social scientist leading empirical and intersectional work on gender and the science, technology, engineering, and mathematics workforce. Paving the way to equity in STEM through research and well-informed policy and practice.
name: Heather Metcalf
title: Director, Research and Analysis at Association for Women in Science
